intro: Acourtia dugesii var. queretarana, commonly known as the Querétaro acourtia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in open habitats such as cliffs or slopes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
